author: dimitri777
title: Cardano in Burmese
description: Lack of official Burmese content . Thus Burmese speakers cannot learn in their native language. There are 51 million speakers globally

f6_assessments.q0:
The Proposer has stated the problem clearly that Burmese speakers cannot learn in their native language and there is lack of official Burmese content. The proposer seeks to solve the problem by providing official Cardano documentation translated into videos in Burmese to educate their community in Sri Lanka about Cardano and the ecosystem. This proposal addressed the challenge by stating that they will prepare a group of people who are willing to contribute to the ecosystem. Proposer stated that the project will bring information to people in their local language that would attract more developers, which is part of the goals of Cardano in Fund9 to bring in more developers into the ecosystem. The project fits within the challenge because it seeks to bring people of Myanmar into the Cardano community, thus the project seeks to add value to the ecosystem by bringing in new community in India. 
Mention is made of key metrics and goals as the number of subscribers to the LanCardano Youtube channel, the number of average views per video, number of comments per video and number of watching hours to be measured. All these mentioned key metrics fit into the challenge well. 
The project also fits into the challenge by taking into consideration how it will scale to address future challenges by bringing in more content. The proposal meets Fund9 objectives because the project will enable more people to become empowered to contribute to the ecosystem and participate because they would have understood Cardano through the project work.
The proposer mentioned the risks associated with this proposal and how to mitigate the risks in detail, mentioning a few here as incidence of COVID variant causing lockdowns and absence of Master Translators due to illness. Mitigating factors were mentioned; among others is that they will have many Translators so that in case of illness they will have a replacement easily. 
With all these factors, the challenge has been effectively addressed by this proposal.
f6_assessments.q1:
This proposer has laid out a comprehensive plan for the project. Mention is made of launching LanCardano Youtube Channel with 6 videos daily and a total of 10-20 videos at end of 3 months. They aim to bring out one translated video every 3 days, which is quite comprehensive. Proposer mentioned that the original videos will have a pace of 140 words per minute and that around 2 hours of content will be published per month. The timeline is quite reasonable. The proposer mentioned that in case of an emergency fund, they will request in Fund10 which is good for planning. The plan is detailed and clear by the facts provided.
The budget total of $11150 is reasonable and it is broken down comprehensively showing detailed cost for transcription, dubbing, editing, publishing, social media campaign, contingency fee and fees for Translators. The highest cost is allotted to Translators fees of $6650 which is more than 50% of the total budget and it is reasonable because translation content forms larger part of the work.
The team that is going to implement the project is made up of four experienced members with skills in marketing, translation, creative writing, entrepreneurship, etc. They are also Cardano community members who are CA/PAs, vPAs, Voters and active members in Town Halls, Circle and Challenge team. Linkedin references of the team members have been provided by the proposal for further referencing. The team is likely to implement the project successfully. The proposer mentioned that they are likely to ask for more support from Catalyst in future proposals, and the team has other proposals in other challenges as well.
With all the facts above, this proposal is highly likely to be implemented successfully.
f6_assessments.q2:
The proposal has provided a clear roadmap for the project. Mention was made of clear solutions to the project. This proposal mentioned that they will measure the progress of work by the number of followers to the LanCardano Youtube Channel, the number of average views per video, the number of watching hours, the number of comments, the number of shares and number of downloads. All these will make tracking of progress successful and lead to successful auditing. 
The project's success will be seen in the awareness created in Cardano in the Burmese speaking community and thereby bringing in more new members into the ecosystem. Mention was made that they will continue to build the channel in future funds and grow the ecosystem. All these ensured that the objectives are clear and can be audited easily. 
The proposal is new and SDG rating provided fit the proposal. 
The information provided is sufficient to audit the progress and the success of the proposal.
f6_assessments.reply: This is a good and fair assessment. You have studied the proposal and gone into detail as required by the PA Guide.

f6_assessments.q0:
This proposal intention is to extinguish the language barrier existent between ADA content and Burmese, which has a 40M people speaking it as mother tong (https://www.worlddata.info/languages/burmese.php). To address this problem the proposer will translate official ADA content, creating dubbed videos.


By diminishing the language barriers, it adds value to ADA ecosystem because it will reach a part of the world population that had no entries in it. Therefore, since ADA aims to be the world used blockchain, it must have content in every language, promoting knowledge and encouraging people to use it. Therefore, the proposal align with this challenge. 

A point that should be mentioned is that this proposal’s bottleneck is the quantity of translating material that the translators can manage. Therefore, in order to scale it is good to have lots of translators involved in this proposal in the future.


The goal of this proposal is reach every Burmese speaker, which also aligns with the aim of reaching the maximum people as possible of ADA.
f6_assessments.q1:
Unfortunately the proposal roadmap is confuse. It does not have a exact quantity of videos per month, therefore it makes hard to evaluate the possibility of being done or what to expect.


The budget is clear, reveling the experience that the team have. It gives clue of how much they can produce and the time length of the content proposed.


The risks are well defined and the mitigation is also explained. However, there is a huge risk that must be taken into account which is the choice of the content. Since the team will be responsible to choose the videos, it might happen a poor choice. Therefore, maybe creating a more interactive profile and make the viewers choose the content might mitigate this risk and have the possibility of creating more engagement in the Channel – which creates more awareness and monetization possibility. Another possibility is add a hashtag for specifics content and then measure which is the winner.


It was provided the team LinkedIn links exposing the experience. However, there is not a specific marketing member, which would be good to include since the aim is having lots of viewers.


As mentioned, the bottleneck of this proposal is the quantity of content managed by the translators, therefore, in order to scale and add more platforms to diffuse content, it’ll need to hire more translators (since it’s a mechanical project)

That being said, the proposal has a high probability of being done and, if managed the raised risks there is a high probability of success.
f6_assessments.q2:
It is quite easy to know if the video was uploaded in YT, however this proposal is missing a method to verify the in between implementation. Maybe creating a Instagram profile to communicate daily with the followers, creating content and interacting with them, showing the making off process. Maybe using this would increase the engagement.


Another noted point is the lack of details in the timetable, which makes hard to know what to expect.

The KPIs provided are related with number os views, hours watched, comments etc, which is sufficient to measure progress.

f6_assessments.q0:
The idea has the ability to dramatically boost the amount of awareness that Burmese speakers already have of the Cardano ecosystem by presenting them with videos that have been translated into their language. According to the author, there are more than 51 million individuals living in different parts of the world who are able to communicate in Burmese, which is a significant number. Through the translation of documentation and the production of content videos geared toward Burmese speakers, the proposal will make it easier for the Burmese-speaking population to have access to Cardano-related material. In addition, the idea will make it possible for a huge number of new people who have quite diverse points of view to join the community. This will bring about a richer diversity of perspectives.
The author has offered a strategy to problem-solving that is clearly defined and intends to give a solution that will last for the long run. The author has also scaled with future difficulties and the Burmese community on the Cardano ecosystem. The author believes that understanding blockchain fundamentals would assist everyone in this region develop better applications. In addition to this, they discuss the potential risks that may arise, as well as some potential responses to these risks, while drawing attention to the difficulty of the situation from a legal standpoint.
In general, the goals of the project correspond to the level of complexity of the tasks that need to be completed. It is also a project that is capable of being scaled up, and it may offer Cardano with benefits on a worldwide scale if it is successful.
f6_assessments.q1:
The proposal provides a thorough timeline and output, including the expected number of translated videos every month and the typical duration of each video.
Team members gave information that was both accessible and credible, and they even included links to their LinkedIn pages. The authors have more than three decades of experience interpreting official papers for the Ministry of Languages, in addition to their prior work with the Sri Lanka Broadcasting Corporation. In addition, they have a background in software engineering. These applicants have the experience and training that gives me confidence in their ability to translate documents and create videos with relevant material for the Burmese community. Also, the budget is set down extremely well, including fees for things like translation, social media marketing, and a contingency fee.
However, I think there are a few points of information that need further information. First, I'd want to learn more about the core of video's subject matters so that the Cardano community can determine whether or not its viewers have a decent understanding of Cardano ecosystem. Second, there's a deficit of publicly available data on how effective certain marketing strategies actually are at drawing in customers.
When additional information is provided, the plan's feasibility increases.
f6_assessments.q2:
In order to permit more precise tracking of progress over the course of three months, the proposer offers a comprehensive road map that outlines the many milestones that need to be achieved. The metrics that are going to be tracked make sense when it comes to evaluating interaction on YouTube, which is a good component that should be measured.
Concerning the question of what the indication of success will appear to be, I believe that it would be more helpful to determine the level of success by first establishing a particular goal to achieve, such as an increase of one thousand members in the Burmese Cardano community; ten proposals submitted by the Khmer community;...
In conclusion, if this project receives funding, I am confident that the initiative will be a great success. It will have a positive influence, bringing Cardano to the attention of a greater number of individuals.
f6_assessments.reply: This is a good and fair assessment. You have studied the proposal and gone into detail as required by the PA Guide.
